definition:
Let $X$ be a set. Let $S(X)$ be the set of permutations of $X$ (i.e. the
set of bijective functions on $X$). Then the act of taking the
composition of two permutations induces a group structure on $S(X)$. We
call this group the [*symmetric group*]{} and it is often denoted
${\rm Sym}(X)$.

When $X$ has a finite number $n$ of elements, we often refer to the
symmetric group as $S_n$, and describe the elements by using cycle
notation.
